data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text: There's a cable that locks the handlebar bag to the bike and you can then lock the handlebar bag closed as well. Granted, it's just a piece of string that needs to be cut to bypass the lock, but it would stop a casual thief.
data.author: Sean Quinn

data.text: - Yeah, I'm aware of the string on the handlebar bag. I used to have one of those bags, but I dislike how far out the front of the bike it puts the weight - even if there isn't a lot in it. Never used the string.
data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text: Well, it is probably more convenient for a thief to take the bag and then search through it at some other calm place than search through it at the place where the bike is... The gain for a thief stealing my pannier with used stuff in it would be very small. But the damage to me would be large... I do occasionally attach the panniers with a Kryptoflex cable to the bike. That will not prevent anyone from still opening them or cutting the Kryptoflex. But it prevents someone from just effortlessly take the panniers.

data.text: Made my own using much thicker cable you buy at the hardware store by the foot. Only use it for quick short stops. The one they sell is very thin and can be cut easily with a simple Leatherman but it stops the opportunitiests from a quick grab and dash attempt - they don't want to be seen going through your stuff. Too obvious and too time consuming. If it's "work" it's not worth their time.
